panels.description: Total requests per second across all Django views right now.
panels.title: Total RPS

panels.description: Percentage of responses that are 5xx errors. Above 1% = trouble.
panels.title: Error Rate %

panels.description: 95th percentile latency ‚Äî 95% of requests are faster than this value.
panels.title: p95 Latency

panels.description: Active PostgreSQL connections right now. Max is usually 100. Above 80 = danger zone.
panels.title: Postgres Active Conns

panels.description: CPU usage per container. Shows which container is consuming the most CPU during load.
panels.title: CPU Usage per Container

panels.description: Memory usage per container in MB. Find the memory hog during load.
panels.title: Memory Usage per Container

panels.description: Active database connections over time. If this plateaus at ~100, you've hit the connection limit and new requests will queue/fail.
panels.title: Active Connections by Database

panels.description: Percentage of data reads served from RAM vs disk. Below 95% means Postgres is reading from disk too often ‚Äî things will be slow. Below 90% is critical.
panels.title: Cache Hit Ratio (createscale)

panels.description: Rows fetched, inserted, updated, deleted per second. Shows how hard the DB is working.
panels.title: Tuple Operations/sec

panels.description: Requests per second broken down by Django view and HTTP method.
panels.title: RPS by View

panels.description: p95 latency per view in ms. The long tail ‚Äî 5% of users experience latency worse than this.
panels.title: p95 Latency by View

panels.description: 4xx and 5xx errors per Django view. Spikes here during load = the endpoint is breaking.
panels.title: Django Errors by View

panels.description: Nginx-level failures (502, 503, 504). If Nginx shows errors but Django doesn't, it means Gunicorn crashed or timed out before Django could respond.
panels.title: Nginx Failures

panels.description: Estimated host CPU usage across all containers. This is THE key metric ‚Äî when it sustains 80%+, you have found the t3.large ceiling.
panels.title: ‚ö° Host CPU % (√∑2 cores)

panels.description: Total requests per second over time ‚Äî the equivalent of Locust's RPS chart, but permanent. Shows the staircase pattern during the soak test.
panels.title: RPS Timeline

panels.description: How long Nginx waited for Gunicorn to respond. Rising values mean the Gunicorn queue is backing up.
panels.title: Nginx ‚Üí Gunicorn Upstream Time

panels.description: 4xx errors (client-side: auth failures, bad requests) vs 5xx errors (server crashes). If 5xx spikes, the server is dying. If only 4xx spikes, it's a client/auth issue.
panels.title: 4xx vs 5xx Error Split

panels.description: All responses stacked by status code category. Green (2xx) should dominate. Any red (5xx) means the server is failing.
panels.title: Request Volume by Status Code

panels.description: Network bytes received and transmitted per container. If any container saturates the NIC, this is where you see it.
panels.title: Network I/O per Container

panels.description: Memory usage per container over time. Watch for steadily climbing lines ‚Äî that indicates a memory leak.
panels.title: Memory by Container (over time)

panels.description: Latency distribution: p50, p90, p95, p99 over time. Watch for the gap between p50 and p99 widening ‚Äî that means tail latency is spiking.
panels.title: Latency Percentiles (p50/p90/p95/p99)
